meanings.definition: Toward the back or dorsal side.
meanings.sent1: The dorsad part of the room had a beautiful view of the garden.
meanings.sent2: The animal's fins were located on its dorsad side.
meanings.sent3: The cat always preferred to sit in the dorsad corner of the house.
meanings.sent4: The old tree leaned slightly in a dorsad direction, seeking the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted a majestic mountain range with dorsad peaks.

meanings.sent1: She walked dorsad to retrace her steps.
meanings.sent2: The car slowly moved dorsad down the narrow alley.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick made the rabbit hop dorsad out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to flow dorsad as he reminisced about his childhood.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed dorsad, against the usual current.

meanings.definition: Moving or facing toward the back.
meanings.sent1: The dorsad motion of the train made her feel queasy.
meanings.sent2: The soldier kept a dorsad stance to watch for any threats.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show had the audience laughing dorsad in their seats.
meanings.sent4: The wind blew dorsad, rustling the leaves in the trees.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship's engines roared as it launched dorsad into space.
